data.title: FC Basel

by rwo power Tue May 22, 2012 8:54 pm

boss wrote:Reus ? never heard btw Xhaka can do everything coz he's a boss,no matter if !

You might want to google around a bit - Marco Reus, formerly of BMG will play for Dortmund from next season. And he belongs to the German NT squad that was called up so far.

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Mon May 28, 2012 10:21 am

Heh. Looks like I'm not alone in my appreciation for Yann Sommer.

On the official FC Basel Website fcb.ch, Yann Sommer was voted "Player of the Season 2011/12" with about a third of the votes: http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28044/16/7

Die Top 7:

1 - Yann Sommer 33.9 %

2 - Alex Frei 24.7 %

3 - Xherdan Shaqiri 9.6 %

4 - Marco Streller 6.8 %

5 - David Abraham 4.5 %

6 - Alex Dragovic 3.2 %

7 - Beni Huggel 3.1 %

Re: FC Basel

by Yeezus Mon Jun 25, 2012 5:51 pm

Basel have signed Marcelo Diaz. Currently a key player for U de Chile. Works very well in the midfield, has great passing ability and a great set piece taker.

RWO, mind keeping me updated on the player?

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Tue Jun 26, 2012 12:01 am

I shall see what I can do. Tomorrow evening at 18:30 CEST, there is a test match of FC Basel against SpVgg Unterhaching at the Sportplatz Warngau (about 50km away from Munich). I have no idea if I can find some stream, but I will look out for one.

On Saturday, 23 Jun 2012, Basel played another test match against Steaua Bucharest, but in the lineup there was no Marcelo Diaz as he hadn't arrived at the club yet. Basel's line-up in general was pretty depleted as several players hadn't joined the training camp yet.

This was Basel's line-up for the Steaua Bucharest friendly which they lost 2-4: Vailati; Philipp Degen, Kovac, Ajeti, Steinhöfer; David Degen (66. Andrist), Cabral (46. Fabian Frei), Yapi (72. Grether), Salah; Alex Frei (66. Vuleta), Streller (72. Pak).

This reminds me, I have to update the Basel squad for the season 2012/13 still. ^^

Re: FC Basel

by Yeezus Tue Jun 26, 2012 1:14 pm

When he comes, he'll be rocking

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Tue Jul 03, 2012 7:00 pm

The new guys at Basel (at least the ones that already showed up) plus the coach Heiko Vogel:

Bernhard Heusler; David Degen; Germano Vailati; Mirko Salvi; Mohamed Salah; Heiko Vogel; Simon Grether; Stjepan Vuleta

I'll update the squad info at the first page as soon as there are some official portrait pics of them with the proper Basel kits.

BTW, the new GK kit of Basel is a somewhat more agreeable colour than the former drab green, grey or yellow:

(You didn't think I'd miss the opportunity to post another pic of Yann Sommer? )

(Photos by Sacha Grossenbacher, Uwe Zinke from fcb.ch )

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Sun Jul 08, 2012 3:42 pm

The next two newcomers for FC Basel were unveiled today: 22-year-old CB Gastón Sauro (formerly Boca Juniors, Argentina) and 25-year-old CM Marcelo Diaz (formerly CF Universidad de Chile). Both signed a 4-year contract until 2016.

Source: http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28174/26/7/7

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Fri Jul 13, 2012 6:54 pm

In Switzerland, the 2012/13 season is underway as of now!

FC Basel right now have their first match away against Servette FC in the Stade de Genève (kickoff was 19:45 GMT+2).

Servette: Gonzalez; Routis, Mfuyi, Schneider, Moubandje; Pasche (59. De Azevedo), Pizzinat; Tréand, Kouassi (81. Gissi), Lang (66. Moutinho); Karanovic.

FC Basel: Sommer; Steinhöfer, Kovac, Dragovic, Park; David Degen (77. Zoua), Cabral, Yapi (92. Grether), Stocker (85. Philipp Degen); Alex Frei, Streller.

At HT it was still a scoreless draw. But at least I got a screenshot of Yann Sommer ^^

59. minute - Marco Streller with a fantastic assist and David Degen scores the first goal for Basel.

So. Full Time.

Servette FC – FC Basel 1893 0:1 (0:0) Stade de Genève. – Audience 8132 – Referee Sacha Kever. Goal: 59. David Degen 0:1 (assist: Streller).

Not a really good match, but the teams fought at least.

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Tue Jul 17, 2012 12:20 pm

Today at 17:45 GMT+2, FC Basel will play away at Flora Tallinn (Estonia) in the first leg of the 2nd round CL qualifiers. *keeps fingers crossed for Basel*

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Sat Jul 21, 2012 7:43 pm

HT FC Basel 0-1 FC Luzern

17. Dario Lezcano

Luzern currently look much better than Basel. The latter can thank Yann Sommer or if could have been 3 goals against. Dunno what the Basel defense are doing today. I'm sure it is not playing football

BTW, Swiss TV is funny - they actually interview players in the half time break!

So. In the second half, the FC Basel seems to have woken. Alex Frei scored the 1:1 equalizer in the 61st minutes, and now Basel keep on attacking.

Eep! Now the Basel defense messed up big time again and Sommer had not the slightest chance when Lezcano scored his second goal in the 66th minute. Yann Sommer doesn't look amused at all.

After one Basel goal wrongfully was called offside, Marco Streller tried it a second time and scored the 2:2 in the 80th minute. Now Basel seem to want to win after all.

FT: FC Basel 2-2 FC Luzern

17. Lezcano

61. Streller

66. Lezcano

80. Streller

Entertaining match, this, and with several really good saves by Yann Sommer.

Re: FC Basel

heyy Rwo 2b fair i still laugh when i see ur post No 31..loool

Good Luck Baseeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeel

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Sun Jul 22, 2012 4:23 pm

Eep, you are right about minute 61. and Alex Frei - I had it right when I wrote it down while I watched the match.

Well, so far the transfer window is still open, and as Eintracht Braunschweig are interested to sign Kwang-Ryong Pak on loan, one never knows whether Basel will look to sign another player or two. They could do with one or two tall new defensive players, if you ask me.

About the Swiss League - well, the overall quality isn't too good. At the moment, Basel will likely run away with the league in due time. (Last season when they won with a huge point difference to the second club, they started out with only 6 points from the first six matches, and this season they already got 4 points from 2 matches against the 4th placed team and the runner-up of the last season.)

About the CL qualification - Basel won 2:0 away against Tallinn, so it is pretty sure they will reach the next round (2nd leg is on Tuesday) where they will most likely meet the Norwegian champion Molde FK. If they also defeat Molde, they'd get into the CL play-offs and only a win there would get Basel into the group stage again. I hope they will make it, but it is in no way assured.

Man of the Match against Luzern and fcb.ch agree

Report about the match from SF Sport

Spoiler:

Last edited by rwo power on Wed Jul 25, 2012 8:53 pm; edited 1 time in total

Re: FC Basel

by rwo power Tue Jul 24, 2012 7:11 pm

Pfffff.... Basel are resting Yann Sommer today for the second leg of the CL quali against Flora Tallinn. I'm not amused at all as I wanted to watch my favourite cute Swiss goalie!

BTW, Molde FK defeated FK Ventspils today, so they are the opponent of Basel for the 3rd CL qualification round.

FC Basel

Vailati

Steinhöfer, Sauro, Dragovic, Voser

D. Degen, Cabral, Diaz, Vuleta

Zoua, Streller

Flora Tallinn

Pedok

Baranov, Palatu, Mets

Peitre, Alliku, Laabus, Frolov, Luigend

Prosa, Luts

9th minute: Basel 1-0 Tallinn, nice header by Zoua after a Steinhöfer assist.

31th minute: Basel 2-0, nice volley by Zoua after an assist by Streller

63th minute: Marcelo Diaz (freekick)

FT: FC Basel 3-0 Flora Tallinn

That means Basel is qualified for the 3rd round of the CL qualification where they meet Molde FK from Norway.
